conclusion: To calculate the work done by the gas from state A to state B in the given cyclic process.
The process from A to B is an isobaric process (constant pressure) at 1 x 10^5 Pa.
The volume changes from 3 L (state A) to 4 L (state B).
The work done in an isobaric process is given by W = p ΔV.
Substitute the given values: p = 1 x 10^5 Pa, ΔV = 4 L - 3 L = 1 L.
Convert the volume change to cubic meters: ΔV = 1 x 10^-3 m^3.
Calculate the work done: W = 1 x 10^5 Pa x 1 x 10^-3 m^3 = 100 J.
The work done by the gas from state A to state B is 100 J.
